title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, reorganize paragraphs, and specify staff requirements for the Office of Environmental Education. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to include staff requirements for the Office of Environmental Education, specifying that activities may be carried out directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to reduce the percentage of funding for environmental education grants. Additionally, grants under this section cannot be used for lobbying activities. SEC. 4 focuses on environmental internships and fellowships. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by removing and redesignating sections, along with making conforming amendments to the table of contents and section 4. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by redesignating sections and making conforming amendments to the table of contents and section 4, including changes to references in various subsections. SEC. 5. National Education Awards. The Administrator may provide awards known as the President's Environmental Youth Awards to young people in grades kindergarten through 12 for outstanding projects promoting local environmental awareness. SEC. 6. Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify the composition of the Advisory Council, with members appointed by the Administrator representing various sectors. Membership on the Task Force is also addressed. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to define the Advisory Council's composition and Task Force membership, allowing representatives from Federal agencies engaged in environmental education. The Advisory Council will now hold biennial meetings on relevant environmental education issues and provide reports and recommendations. The Advisory Council will now hold biennial meetings on relevant environmental education issues and provide reports and recommendations. Additionally, SEC. 7 establishes the National Environmental Education and Training Foundation. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and make conforming amendments to related sections. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to rename the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and update related sections accordingly. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to rename the Foundation to "Foundation for Environmental Education" and update the number of directors and conditions of donations accordingly. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funds allocated for specific activities are limited to ensure proper distribution. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for specific activities, with funds allocated for environmental education grants and the Foundation for Environmental Education. Administrative expenses are limited to 25 percent of the total amount available. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
